Documentation

Tutorials

Learn SnapTray through real-world, end-to-end workflows instead of isolated features.

How to use this section

If you are new to SnapTray, start with Quick Share (30s) first. Each tutorial is task-based and includes a goal, steps, and a final validation checklist.

Recommended learning paths

Your goal Start here Then continue
Capture and send screenshots fast Quick Share (30s) Region Capture
Report bugs with clear evidence Bug Report Workflow Annotation Tools
Keep references visible while working Live Reference with Pin Pin Window
Record and share product demos Recording Demo Recording

Tutorial style

  • Every guide is written as a repeatable workflow.
  • Default shortcuts are included so you can execute quickly.
  • Each guide ends with a quality checklist so your output is share-ready.

Before you begin

  1. Complete Getting Started.
  2. Confirm your hotkeys in Hotkeys.
  3. Confirm output folders in Settings.

Need feature details?

Tutorials focus on outcomes. For full option references, use:

  • Region Capture
  • Annotation Tools
  • Pin Window
  • Recording
  • CLI

SnapTray

Desktop-grade screenshot and recording workflows, designed for speed and clarity.

Made with Qt 6 and C++17
